But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Sealed Air Corporation (NYSE: SEE) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics (as of November 1, 2024, close):**  
- Stock Price: $34.09  
- Market Capitalization: $4.92 billion  
- 52-Week Range: $28.59 - $44.03  

## Company Overview  
Sealed Air Corporation (SEE) is a global leader in innovative packaging solutions and performance materials, serving food, e-commerce, and protective packaging markets. Founded in 1960 and headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina, the company operates through two main segments: Food (63% of 2023 sales) and Protective (37%). In Food, SEE provides vacuum packaging systems like Cryovac® for proteins, liquids, and produce, enhancing freshness, safety, and shelf life for meat, poultry, seafood, and cheese processors. Protective offerings include Bubble Wrap®, Instapak® foams, and mailers for e-commerce and industrial shipping. With ~17,000 employees across 50+ countries, SEE generated $5.10 billion in 2023 net sales, emphasizing sustainability through recyclable, bio-based materials. The company leverages automation, digital tools like SEE Cloud for monitoring, and a portfolio of 5,000+ patents to drive efficiency. Recent strategic shifts focus on divesting non-core assets to streamline toward higher-margin food and protective growth, amid a packaging industry valued at ~$1 trillion globally, where SEE holds niche leadership in vacuum shrink bags (~25-30% share in proteins) and air cushions (~20% in e-commerce protective). (198 words)

## Recent Developments  
- **Q3 2024 Earnings (October 31, 2024):** Net sales $1.368 billion (-1.9% YoY); GAAP diluted EPS $0.46; Adjusted EPS $0.75 (beat estimates). Food segment sales +1.5% (volumes +2.8%); Protective -6.1%. Gross margin 32.1% (up 110 bps). Full-year 2024 guidance: Adjusted EPS $2.80-$2.95.  
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (July 30, 2024):** Net sales $1.351 billion (-2.2% YoY); Adjusted EPS $0.64.  
- **Diversified Products Divestiture (September 17, 2024):** Sold North American Diversified Products unit (rigid mailers, papers) to Sonoco for $180 million (expected close Q4 2024), proceeds for debt reduction/share repurchases.  
- **Sustainability Report (October 2024):** 25% reduction in Scope 1/2 emissions since 2019 baseline; 45% recyclable/reusable packaging portfolio.  
- **Leadership Change (August 2024):** Appointed Sue Clark as COO to drive operational excellence.  

## Growth Strategy  
- Prioritize Food segment expansion via protein pouching and case-ready solutions; target mid-single-digit organic growth.  
- Invest $100-120M annually in capex for automation/digitalization (e.g., SEE Cloud IoT platform).  
- Sustainability focus: 100% recyclable packaging by 2025; partnerships for bio-resins.  
- Share repurchases: $100M+ authorized post-divestiture; reduced debt to 3.1x net leverage (Q3 2024).  
- Margin expansion: Target 35%+ adjusted EBITDA margins through productivity ($50M savings in 2024).  

## Headwinds and Tailwinds  

| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Strong Food volumes (+2.8% Q3); divestitures unlock $180M+ value; $200M+ free cash flow 2024 outlook. | Protective destocking (-6% volumes Q3); resin inflation pressures. |
| **Sector (Packaging)** | E-commerce surge (global +10% CAGR); protein consumption growth (+3% annually); sustainability regs favor innovators. | Industrial slowdown (manufacturing PMI ~48); currency headwinds (strong USD). |

## Existing Products/Services  
- **Food:** Cryovac® vacuum shrink bags/films (proteins: 25-30% global market share); Liquid Packaging (dairy/cheese); Produce solutions.  
- **Protective:** Bubble Wrap® (20% air cushion share); Instapak® foam-in-place; Polyair mailers/void fill.  
- Services: Automated packaging systems, leasing, maintenance via ~100 global centers.  

## New Products/Services/Projects  
- **Bobst Alliance (September 2024):** Co-develop fully recyclable shrink sleeve films for food/beverage, launch H1 2025.  
- **Bio-Based Resins Expansion (Q3 2024):** 20% renewable content in select Cryovac films; pilot with protein processors.  
- **Digital Suite Upgrades:** SEE Cloud V2 (rolled out Q2 2024) for predictive maintenance; AI yield optimization pilots.  
- **Sustainability Projects:** Circulution® recycling program expansion to Europe (2025 rollout).  

## Market Share Approximations and Forecast  
- **Current (2024 estimates):** Food vacuum packaging ~25-30% (proteins leader); Protective air cushions ~20%; overall packaging <1% global but #1 in niches.  
- **Forecast:** Stable-to-slight growth in Food (gain 1-2% share via pouches); Protective flat-to-decline 1-3% amid competition; overall +1-2% through 2026 on sustainability edge (per company guidance/investor day March 2024).  

## Competitor Comparison  

| Metric (TTM as of Q3 2024) | SEE | Amcor (AMCR) | Berry Global (BERY) | Sonoco (SON) |
|----------------------------|-----|--------------|----------------------|--------------|
| Revenue | $5.2B | $13.9B | $12.7B | $6.8B |
| EBITDA Margin | 20.1% | 18.5% | 15.2% | 14.8% |
| EV/EBITDA | 9.2x | 10.5x | 8.8x | 9.5x |
| Debt/LTM EBITDA | 3.1x | 2.8x | 3.5x | 2.9x |
| YTD Stock Perf. | -14% | +5% | -10% | -5% |
| **Edge** | Niche food leadership, sustainability | Scale/diversity | Cost leadership | Paperboard strength |

SEE trades at discount to peers on margins/debt improvement trajectory.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients  
- **Partnerships:** Bobst (recyclable films, 2024); PepsiCo (sustainable snack packaging, ongoing); Huhtamaki (joint recycling, 2023).  
- **M&A:** Buyer of Emerald Packaging (2023, $300M, films expansion); Seller of polystyrene cups (2021, $1.15B); Recent divestiture to Sonoco. No major inbound M&A announced.  
- **Major Clients:** Tyson Foods, JBS, Cargill (proteins, ~30% Food sales); Amazon, UPS (e-commerce protective); Nestlé, Unilever (CPG). Potential: Expansion into plant-based/alternative proteins (e.g., Beyond Meat pilots).  

## Other Qualitative Measures  
- **ESG Strength:** CDP A-List (2024); 95% renewable electricity goal by 2030.  
- **Innovation Pipeline:** 200+ R&D projects; 15% sales from products <5 years old.  
- **Labor/Supply Chain:** Union-free; resin supply secured via long-term contracts (mitigates 10-15% input volatility).  
- **Online Sentiment (StockTwits/Reddit, Oct 2024):** Neutral-bullish on divestiture/debt cut; concerns on volumes (avg. rating 7/10).  

## Investment Recommendation  
- **Buy Rating: 7/10 (Hold-to-Buy)**  
  Rationale: Undervalued at 9x EV/EBITDA vs. peers (10-11x); Food resilience + divestiture catalysts support 10-15% upside. Q3 beat and guidance intact amid macro recovery. Moderate risk from volumes/cyclicals balanced by balance sheet strength ($475M cash Q3).  
- **Estimated Fair Value: $42** (23% upside from $34.09).  
  DCF-based (8% WACC, 3% terminal growth; incorporates $2.90 EPS 2025 consensus, 15x P/E). Targets strong growth (EPS CAGR +8% 2024-2026) for moderate-risk portfolios. Entry below $36; stop-loss $30.
